title: EIA reports a rise in U.S. natural-gas supplies of 98 billion cubic feet
text: The U.S. Energy Information Administration reported Thursday that domestic supplies of natural gas rose by 98 billion cubic feet for the week ended Oct. 4. The data were expected to show a build of 97 billion cubic feet, on average, according to analysts polled by S&P Global Platts. Total stocks now stand at 3.415 trillion cubic feet, up 472 billion cubic feet from a year ago, but 9 billion below the five-year average, the government said. November natural gas NGX19, -0.27% traded at $2.245 per million British thermal units, down 1.1 cents, or 0.5%, from Wednesday's settlement. It was trading at $2.262 before the data.
description: The U.S. Energy Information Administration reported Thursday that domestic supplies of natural gas rose by 98 billion cubic feet for the week ended Oct. 4....
